a combination of both uh I've been

seen a lot of uh manipulative power

of all this experience and all of this
kind of
bitterness and then um I got the

done a lot of research in Hollywood in

filter through all of this

it's a mix of things
well you're always feeling powerless in
life um so early on when I was working
in Hollywood um as a writer I would uh
work with a director or a film company
and what I would end up coming in on the
end and kind of writing whole scenes and
then they would take it away from me and
do whatever the hell they wanted with it
or they would take my name out of the
whole thing and I the only thing you
could do when you work for a giant
Leviathan like Hollywood in which they
just swallow your individuality up is to
leave it and I left it and I went and
wrote books because uh and oddly enough
now I'm going back into it because we're
trying to make a film version of the 48
Laws of Power but now I've got the power
on my side because I wrote the book they
can't mess with me they don't do what I
want then they're they're gone but
before there was nothing I could do so I
left and I tell people a lot like if
you're in an abusive relationship or
you're working for what I we call a
psychotic
boss sometimes the only option is to
leave because your emotions get so
entangled with these manipulative people
that staying there you're just helpless
because they're good at these passive
aggressive games and you're not so you
have to leave you know working on this
and I'm still in the situation working
on the new book uh the 50th
law I I love 50 Cent he's a wonderful
person but he's a celebrity and he's
very busy and sometimes it's difficult
to get I wanted to get more action from

that so I had to confront my own
powerlessness in the situation and in
the end he came through but I had to
kind of take a step back and just let

have to do in life
